title: I have a novel I've written and is no longer published. Can I rewrite it? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on whether the rights have reverted to you under the original publishing contract. If not, in order to re-publish it (which I assume is why you’re asking about rewriting it), you would have to transform it so thoroughly that it’s no longer the same book in any substantive sense.

If you still own the copyrights to the material, and no publisher has a claim to it, why not? Just check the contract you signed with your original publisher. Then go to Reedsy.com to find a community of independent editors, book cover designers, and book marketers who can be contracted directly by you to help you get the book published and promoted. Reedsy also offers all kinds of articles for newbies to learn about marketing online, on social media, etc. Choose an independent publishing group from any number that are available—Barnes & Noble and Amazon both have publishing services for independent authors, and there are others, like Lulu, etc. And you’re all set!
